This was based on the pasta tasting menu was one of the best meals I have ever had in my life. I only wish I had the alcohol capacity to also have had the wine pairing but I'm an uber lightweight and was so full by the end of the tasting anyways I was glad I didn't have to share stomach room with booze.

Most recently, I recommended to my foodie boss to go here for the Truffle tasting menu that I would be missing due to a poorly timed vacay to Hawaii ;).

He enjoyed it so much he signed up him and his daughter for the brunch in a couple weeks. (This is a man who raves about French Laundry btw!)
author: Veronica E.

description:
This place is da bomb!!

Owner is a Cornell graduate, and winemaker has great roots (pun intended).

I was there on my bday and the theme was Tomatoes and Rose.  I absolutely love tomatoes, so I was in heaven.  There were 7 courses, and each course was better than the last.  I loved the entire concept from beginning to end.  Cool place with great vibe, fantastic food, incredible wines.  I loved it when each course arrives, the chef comes out and tells us about it, followed by the winemaker describing his selection.

5 stars in my gourmet book.  Thanks for creating such a memorable birthday dinner!
author: Edward A.

description: Fantastic meal for a belated valentines dinner with the wife. Food was great -- especially the egg Ravioli and Tuna Crudo. Thoughtful wine pairings. Great staff and atmosphere. Might become regulars after this wonderful evening!
author: Scott G.

description:
Wanna lead your GF somewhere?!)
this is place for u
have fun
author: Chris B.

description:
amazing - i've been to great restaurants in SF and nothing compares. the team is personal and intimate with you, ensuring you have a great time. 

the menu is perfect and seasonal. we had two beginning dishes besides those listed on the menu. an amazing deal for such a talented chef.
author: Jean C.

description: The food was amazing! I visited Sorrel for a nice night out and was not disappointed. Plating was lovely, fresh, and seasonal. Definitely go for the wine pairing, these guys do their homework and choose wine that pairs very well with the food.
author: Anthony J.

description: Expertly crafted meals, and beautifully plated.  Very friendly staff.  Get the wine pairing!
author: Angus M.

description:
Perfect experience.
All dishes and pairing are excellent, great combo and presentation. Every bites of the menu are great.
But the best is to see the cooks assembling all the plates and serve themselves all the guess together and explain their enthusiasm.
author: Yann K.

description: Good food and price-wise it's worth everything you're getting.  Wine pairing was well matched with really good food.  Definitely one that I'll go back to.  Thanks for a fun dinner Sorrel!
author: klb l.

description: So we had the same dinner as David K, same seating. But our experience was clearly better. For one, we sat in the kitchen at the chefs table. Watching the activity and seeing each dish composed changes the experience. It ups your appreciation for all the elements that layer flavor and texture into each dish. I'm a salt fiend, but found little need to add to the dishes. Alex's pastas are always fantastic, Saturdays dumplings no exception. We have eaten at Sorrel 5 or 6 times over the last 2 years, and have always left delighted with the food. It's creative, fresh, interesting without ever being fussy, and mostly delicious. Prices are reasonable, quality and quantity of food excellent, and frankly it's nice to not have to decide what to eat, but know what you're getting will surprise and excite you. Highly recommend.
author: Valerie K.

description:
Absolutely incredible meal. These guys are doing some impressive things with their pop up. Alex is a creative genius in the kitchen, and Brennan brings a level of customer service unparalleled in the local restaurant scene. They provided surprise courses and the wine pairings were a delight. I would recommend this meal to all of my friends and family.

Edit: late night edit, mind blown by this meal. I lived five years in New Orleans and have eaten amazing food and this experience was truly exceptional.
author: Adam F.

description: Sorrel provided such a unique dining experience. We sat at the Chef's table to watch all the action and they did not disappoint. The staff were engaging, explained the food and the wine pairing selections. Would definitely dine again at Sorrel.
author: Paulette M.

description: Well, I have to admit I was skeptical when I arrived at the location and realized Sorrel was a pop up. (I didn't read the reviews or details, just wanted to try something new.) I'm happy to say I was wrong to be concerned. The food was wonderful, the service great and attentive and the setting was lovely. One talented chef!
author: Andrea S.

description: Without a doubt, one of the most remarkable dining experiences of my life. Each delicacy was served with care and attention to excellent service. The wines served with each course were paired beautifully with each course. I hope to return for more! Go and try it for yourself.
author: Richard C.

description: We had the most amazing dinner at Sorrel.  It was an anniversary celebration and the meal was one of the best we have ever had!  The atmosphere was so fun and it was great to watch the chefs prepare the meal.  We had a party of 14 and we were all so happy with the food, wine pairing and the fun detailed explanations of each course.  Every course was presented beautifully and we could not decide which one we liked best!  This is a must for foodies and all who love great food, wine and comradery with the chefs.  We cannot wait to go back.
author: Kim C.

description:
Not worth the price. Service was great, the pop up location very charming (but maddeningly noisy), and the experience quite unique. Unfortunately the fold wasn't as good as expected: 
+ wine selection was consistently great 
+ the pasta (agnoloti) was out of this world. 
- The pork wasn't too tasty, even the pork belly felt insipid. 
- The rosemary popcorn was cold and oily.
author: Antonio M.

description: Came back from Sorrel last night. Fantastic meal, fantastic service, fantastic wine pairings. Just our second time there but those two times have been great! Keep up the good work guys!
author: Sven S.

description:
Fantastic.  Happened upon this place through my Yelp browsings, and was sucked in by the amazing reviews and gorgeous looking food.  I was shocked at how easy it was to get a reservation at the last minute, as well as how reasonably priced (by SF/Oakland standards) it was.  We were also lucky that my friend and her husband were available at the last minute to join us as well.  We were first seated at a regular table, but then given the option to move to the chef's table, which we gladly took advantage of so that all of the beautiful food prep was in clear view for us.

As soon as we were seated, we were given a delicious bowl of seasoned popcorn to share.  Next up was an amuse bouche of rye crackers served with smoked trout, roe, and eggplant puree (kind of like a hummus); so tasty!  First course was their namesake sorrel salad, which was perfectly balanced with a light creamy dressing, Asian pears, cucumber, and radish.  Next course was tagliatelle with garlic butter sauce with scallions, tomatoes, and corn, with tiny bits of razor clams; would have loved a bit more of the clam included, but the little bits added good flavor.  Main course I think was my favorite of the night, almost an interesting take on chicken cordon bleu.  It was guinea hen that had been poached in milk then fried with this wonderfully crispy outer layer, stuffed with cheese.  This was served with delicata squash atop a small dollop of ricotta and Beluga lentils.  Loved this dish, savored every bite.  Before the main dessert came out, we were served these delicious ginger cookies.  The dessert was an awesome chocolate custard/mousse type thing, topped with edible flowers and crystallized ginger.  There was a small helping of lemon merengue and passion fruit on the side.  Would have loved to have had some espresso with dessert.  We did the wine pairings, and all were very tasty and matched well with the food.

Service was friendly and attentive, and the courses were timed extremely well.  I'm still in shock at the value of this fabulous dinner.  I'm hopeful that they will be able to follow through with their plan to eventually open a brick and mortar location.  In the meantime, I'd love to go back and try some of their other delicious offerings again at this location.  Bravo!
author: Danielle B.

description: Delicious and beautiful! Intimate and classy atmosphere. We really enjoyed dinner and were pleased with the balance of flavors. The rock shrimp gnocchi had a phenomenal sauce with chilies. I wish we had bread to mop it up with. The dessert was a perfect finish- the warm vanilla sauce made the chocolate semifreddo melt like gelato. We left there full and satisfied, and will be back again.
author: kim p.

description: The prix fixe menu (around $55/pp) started off strong: 1. Fluke Crudo with smoked chicories, black olives, asian pears and concord grapes followed by semolina rigatoni...just an amazing concoction of diverse flavors. However, once we got to the lone willow pork shoulder, my heightened expectations were quickly rattled. The pork shoulder was very tasty but too much fat for my liking. Additionally, it was very difficult to eat the pork shoulder with fork and knife from a bowl. The dessert was a winter squash bread which happened to be too sweet for me. Would I recommend this place, yes of course and I'd certainly go back despite the latter portion of our dining experience.
author: Pauleena L.

description: I guess you might call us Sorrel "regulars". We've been dining with this fantastic group for more than 2 years now. We have never left disappointed. We bring our out-of-town guests to Sorrel dinners, each commenting on how special both the food and atmosphere is. It is touching to see a group of friends repeatedly creating delicious food and an inviting atmosphere. You can tell that the Sorrel group is proud of their accomplishments, and they should be! After not dining with the crew for 5 months, we walked in last night to smiles/welcomes/hugs. In a city with a fantastic, but sometimes cold, dining scene-- it is great to feel a sense of community. We left last night, as usual, amazed by the creations of Alex (the head chef) and spoiled by the rest of the crew's service. Thank you all! Katie+Luis
author: katie w.

description: Been to a lot of Michelin star restaurants. While it's not a Michelin star, it should definitely get one. The food, display, and service was amazing! I am definitely coming back and will bring my friends here too!
author: Christina K.

description: Never been to a pop-up before so checking out sorrel while im in the city. Very accomodating and one of a kind great service! Food was heavenly from the start til the end! You can see all the fresh ingredients and can have a peek in the kitchen while they're in action creating the masterpiece. As for the price, its worth every penny! I love the teamwork!  It was a really great experience all in all, would definitely come back again and very excited for what's next because the menu changes every week!
author: Chey I.

description: Sorrel is amazing! Incredibly fresh locally sourced ingredients. Sign up for their email and follow them. They catered a function at equinox tonight. A perfectly prepared risotto, pork sliders, fresh arugula salad with pomegranate seeds. Met one of the partners, Brennan, who was very gracious. You can tell they are putting their hearts into the food. Can't wait to dine with them again.
author: Erndog R.

description: Top to bottom amazing. These guys have been working together now for over two years and yet it seems Sorrel is better and better each time I go. Fresh ingredients, creatively done, with a fun and energetic team. This place is going to go far, just wait!
author: Lily C.

description: Amazing experience.  The amount of detail and passion put into each course is extraordinary.  Corn casoncelli was unbelievable.  Best little known experience in town!
author: Joshua R.

description: It is a pop-up, so it has the similar issues as other pop-ups, for example, long lag time between courses. However, the food and wine was very good. I hope Alex Hong, the chef, will open a his own restaurant soon.
author: YueStudio Y.

description: I'm still dreaming about those pork ribs!!!! So tender, juicy and served with seeded mustard sauce OMMMMMM! Greetings from Finland yayayaayyyyy!!!
author: Anna L.

description: We enjoyed a wonderful meal at the Chef's table last weekend. The tasting menu was amazing--delicious and innovative with perfect wine pairings. Chef Hong's crew is attentive and friendly. The meal was nicely paced and the venue was warm and inviting. I heartily recommend Sorrel!
author: Karin B.

description: Deserves the 5-star rating that everyone else is giving, this place is amazing.  I went with 10 people for a bachelor party, we got the dinner ($55) plus most of us got the wine pairing ($35).  I am not used to spending this much on dinner, but I'm very glad I did.  Everything on the menu was delicious, especially the trout (crudo, with veggies, in flavorful tomato-water which they pour into each person's bowl after serving) and the pork (in some kind of sweet pepper sauce, just perfectly falling off the bone without being mushy).  Every plate was cleared by everyone.  I'm usually skeptical of wine pairings but they really did match well -- citrussy white with the trout, heavier as you went on.  They also gave us a bunch of extra things that were not on the menu that were delicious.  And the chef comes out and talks about the food.  Just an amazing experience, I hope to come back sometime.  Best meal I have eaten in SF (previous was probably Kokkari, if that makes you trust or ridicule my judgement).
author: Ilana C.

description: Great food in a home style setting in an unexpected purple home in mission. Loved the pop up style and hospitality from the owners.
author: Pooja S.

description: INCREDIBLE!!!! That was the most magical meal I have had in a long time - probably top 5 of my life. The lamb was so tender it melted in your mouth and matched perfectly with the puffed quinoa and other fun surprises that decorated it. The crab risotto blew my mind, the sauce Grenobloise was a delight, and I begged for seconds of the dessert. The entire staff was smiley, friendly, kind and very timely! Absolutely fantastic. Well done!!!
author: Anja W.

description: Alex and his team are what every pop up should be. The dishes are very creative and innovative, while still keeping a simple elegance. I've been to a number of Sorrel dinners now and I don't think I've ever had a dish that wasn't executed perfectly. These guys are the real deal, and I'm looking forward to dining with them for years to come.
author: Lowell B.

description: My 3rd time at sorrel and chef Alex hong is amazing. Service is always on point and the food is even better with a weekly changing menu. If you're looking for something exclusive in the city sorrel is the place! :)
author: Lauren B.

description: Absolutely incredible. I was truly blown away by my meal with this team! I've been to my fair share of "fancy" restaurants in the city, and Alex easily blew them out of the water. This is one of those meals where every bite is completely savored and you're sad to have it end. Sam, who was in charge of the wine also did an excellent job pairing the food to compliment the meal perfectly. The whole team was friendly and very gracious. If they opened up their own restaurant they would succeed with flying colors. I honestly recommend to anyone.
author: Kali H.
